a1: Owner can read, write, execute (7). Group and others can read and execute but not write (5).
q2: What is the difference between 644 and 755?
a2: 644 gives owner read/write, others read-only. 755 adds execute permission, typically used for directories and scripts.
a3: Almost never in production. 777 gives full permissions to everyone, which is a security risk. Use it only for temporary testing.
